page.title: 12LANDSCAPE, HAYDON BRIDGE.
page.content: Field & Place names reflect our super-mongrel origins. Most names proved to be of Old English origin, but a few were Old Norse and a few Middle English, this last showing Norman French influence.Outstanding field-names included:{Cleatley}O.E._ clay pasture:{Whinnetley} M.E._Gorse pasture:{Holm Bank} O.N._riverside pasture.{Colley Law}is now a plantation but in 1860 gave its name to 4 fields,O.E._coal hill Among Farm names were{Moralee} O.E._ marshy clearing;{Rattenraw}M.E._ rat infested.Landscape features included{ {haugh}-alluvial land;{heugh}-steep slope, both Old English.{Crummy} apparently meant good quality! Residents & visitors to School were interested in these names & some fields will now recover their ancient titles.
